log.name: log

log_error.name: log_error
log_error.summary: Puts the PHP errors into a JSON file.

has_prop.name: has_prop
has_prop.summary: Check if an array or an object has the given property

has_props.name: has_props
has_props.summary: Check if an array or an object has the given properties

make_storage_path.name: make_storage_path

clean_storage_path.name: clean_storage_path

merge_objects.name: merge_objects
merge_objects.summary: Returns to a merged object from two objects.

merge_arrays.name: merge_arrays
merge_arrays.summary: Returns to a merged array from two or more arrays.

to_object.name: to_object
to_object.summary: Converts a JSON string or an array into an object.

to_array.name: to_array
to_array.summary: Converts a JSON string or an object into an array.

js_object.name: js_object

indent_json.name: indent_json
indent_json.summary: Indents a flat JSON string to make it human-readable.

remove_empty.name: remove_empty
remove_empty.summary: Returns an object or an array cleaned of all empty values.

arguments.name: arr
arguments.description: space If "true" the spaces are removed, default: "false".

to_groups.name: to_groups
to_groups.summary: Converts an indexed array into a numeric array where the original index is a property.

is_assoc.name: is_assoc
is_assoc.summary: Checks if the given array is associative.

get_dump.name: get_dump
get_dump.summary: Returns a dump of the given variable.

get_hdump.name: get_hdump
get_hdump.summary: Returns an HTML dump of the given variable.

hdump.name: hdump
hdump.summary: Dumps the given variable in HTML.

adump.name: adump
adump.summary: Adaptative dump, i.e. dunps in text if CLI, HTML otherwise.

build_options.name: build_options
build_options.summary: Returns the HTML code for creating the <option> tag(s) based on an array.

description_parts.content: If the array is indexed, the index will be used as value *

arguments.name: selected
arguments.description: label A label for empty value

to_keypair.name: to_keypair
to_keypair.summary: Converts a numeric array into an associative one, alternating key and value.

arguments.name: arr
arguments.description: If false no index protection will be performed

max_with_key.name: max_with_key
max_with_key.summary: Returns the maximum value of a given property from a 2 dimensions array.

arguments.name: ar
arguments.description: Where to check the property value from

min_with_key.name: min_with_key
min_with_key.summary: Returns the minimum value of an index from a multidimensional array.

debug.name: debug
debug.summary: Gets the backtrace and dumps or logs it into a file.

map.name: map
map.summary: Applies the given function at all levels of a multidimensional array (if defined param $item).

arguments.name: fn
arguments.description: The function to be applied to the items of the array

arguments.name: items
arguments.description: If null the function will be applied just to the item of the parent array

find.name: find
find.summary: Returns the array's first index, which satisfies the 'where' condition.

filter.name: filter

sum.name: sum

get_row.name: get_row
get_row.summary: Returns the first row of an array to satisfy the where parameters ({@link find()).

get_field.name: get_field
get_field.summary: Returns the first value of a specific field of an array.

arguments.name: where
arguments.description: The field where to look for

pick.name: pick
pick.summary: Returns a reference to a subarray targeted by an array $keys.

sort.name: sort
sort.summary: Sorts the items of an array.

sort_by.name: sort_by
sort_by.summary: Sorts the items of an indexed array based on a given $key.

is_windows.name: is_windows
is_windows.summary: Checks if the operating system, from which PHP is executed, is Windows or not.

curl.name: curl
curl.summary: Makes a Curl call towards a URL and returns the result as a string.

last_curl_code.name: last_curl_code

get_tree.name: get_tree
get_tree.summary: Returns the given array or object as a tree structure ready for a JS tree.

make_tree.name: make_tree
make_tree.summary: Returns a view of an array or object as a JS tree.
make_tree.description:
*
```php
\bbn\x::dump(\bbn\x::make_tree([['id' => 1,'name' => 'Andrew','fname' => 'Williams','children' =>[['name' => 'Emma','age' => 6],['name' => 'Giorgio','age' => 9]]], ['id' => 2,'name' => 'Albert','fname' => 'Taylor','children' =>[['name' => 'Esther','age' => 6],['name' => 'Paul','age' => 9]]], ['id' => 3,'name' => 'Mike','fname' => 'Smith','children' =>[['name' => 'Sara','age' => 6],['name' => 'Fred','age' => 9]]]]));
/* string
   0
     id: 1
     name: Andrew
     fname: Williams
     children:
       0
         name: Emma
         age: 6
       1
         name: Giorgio
         age: 9
   1
     id: 2
     name: Albert
     fname: Taylor
     children
       0
         name: Esther
         age: 6
       1
         name: Paul
         age: 9
   2
     id: 3
     name: Mike
     fname: Smith
     children
     0
       name: Sara
       age: 6
     1
       name: Fred
       age: 9
```

description_parts.content:
\bbn\x::dump(\bbn\x::make_tree([['id' => 1,'name' => 'Andrew','fname' => 'Williams','children' =>[['name' => 'Emma','age' => 6],['name' => 'Giorgio','age' => 9]]], ['id' => 2,'name' => 'Albert','fname' => 'Taylor','children' =>[['name' => 'Esther','age' => 6],['name' => 'Paul','age' => 9]]], ['id' => 3,'name' => 'Mike','fname' => 'Smith','children' =>[['name' => 'Sara','age' => 6],['name' => 'Fred','age' => 9]]]]));
/* string
   0
     id: 1
     name: Andrew
     fname: Williams
     children:
       0
         name: Emma
         age: 6
       1
         name: Giorgio
         age: 9
   1
     id: 2
     name: Albert
     fname: Taylor
     children
       0
         name: Esther
         age: 6
       1
         name: Paul
         age: 9
   2
     id: 3
     name: Mike
     fname: Smith
     children
     0
       name: Sara
       age: 6
     1
       name: Fred
       age: 9

from_csv.name: from_csv
from_csv.summary: Formats a CSV line(s) and returns it as an array.

to_csv.name: to_csv
to_csv.summary: Formats an array as a CSV string.

is_same.name: is_same
is_same.summary: Checks if two files are the same.

retrieve_array_var.name: retrieve_array_var

retrieve_object_var.name: retrieve_object_var

check_properties.name: check_properties

count_properties.name: count_properties
count_properties.summary: Counts the properties of an object.

to_excel.name: to_excel
to_excel.summary: Creates an Excel file from a given array.

arguments.name: file
arguments.description: titles Set it to false if you don't want the columns titles. Default true

make_uid.name: make_uid

arguments.name: binary
arguments.description: Set it to true if you want a binary UID

arguments.name: hyphens
arguments.description: Set it to true if you want hypens to seperate the UID

convert_uids.name: convert_uids
convert_uids.summary: Converts a hex UID to a binary UID. You can also give an array or an object to convert the array's items or the object's properties.

compare_floats.name: compare_floats
compare_floats.summary: Compares two float numbers with the given operator.

json_base64_encode.name: json_base64_encode
json_base64_encode.summary: Encodes an array's values to the base64 encoding scheme. You can also convert the resulting array into a JSON string (default).

json_base64_decode.name: json_base64_decode
json_base64_decode.summary: Decodes the base64 array's values. You can also give a JSON string of an array.

index_by_first_val.name: index_by_first_val
index_by_first_val.summary: Creates an associative array based on the first array's value.

indexOf.name: indexOf

lastIndexOf.name: lastIndexOf

output.name: output
